Title: Classic Scrambled Eggs
Description: A quick and easy recipe for creamy scrambled eggs, perfect for breakfast.

Steps.Content: Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk with milk, salt, and pepper.
Melt butter in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan and gently stir until softly set.

Title: Tomato Soup
Description: A comforting tomato soup made from fresh tomatoes and spices.

Steps.Content: Chop the tomatoes, onion, and garlic.
Saut√© onion and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Add tomatoes and vegetable stock, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Blend the soup until smooth and season with salt and pepper.

Title: Pasta Carbonara
Description: A creamy, cheesy pasta with bacon, eggs, and parmesan.

Steps.Content: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente.
Fry bacon until crispy.
Mix eggs and grated parmesan in a bowl.
Toss cooked spaghetti with bacon and remove from heat.
Add the egg mixture and stir until creamy.

Title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
Description: A healthy stir-fry with various vegetables and soy sauce.

Steps.Content: Chop all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
Heat olive oil in a wok or large pan.
Add vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes.
Add soy sauce and stir well.

Title: Garlic Bread
Description: A simple and delicious garlic bread recipe, perfect as a side dish.

Steps.Content: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F).
Mix softened butter with minced garlic and parsley.
Spread the mixture onto sliced baguette.
Bake in the oven for 10-12 minutes until golden.

Title: Cheese Omelette
Description: A simple and delicious cheese omelette.

Steps.Content: Crack the eggs into a bowl and whisk with salt, pepper, and cheese.
Melt butter in a pan over medium heat.
Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook until set, gently folding the edges.

Title: Mushroom Soup
Description: A creamy mushroom soup with fresh mushrooms and spices.

Steps.Content: Chop the mushrooms, onion, and garlic.
Saut√© the onions and garlic in a pot with some oil until soft.
Add the chopped mushrooms and cook until they release their juices.
Pour in the vegetable stock and let the soup simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper, then blend the soup until smooth.

Title: Egg Fried Rice
Description: A quick and tasty egg fried rice recipe.

Steps.Content: Cook rice according to package instructions.
Scramble the eggs in a pan with some oil or butter.
Add chopped carrots and garlic to the pan, and cook until soft.
Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir-fry with soy sauce.

Title: Broccoli and Cheese Casserole
Description: A hearty casserole with broccoli and melted cheese.

Steps.Content: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F).
Steam the broccoli until tender.
Saut√© the onion in butter until soft.
Combine steamed broccoli, saut√©ed onion, and cheese in a casserole dish.
Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Title: Bacon and Eggs
Description: A classic breakfast combination of bacon and eggs.

Steps.Content: Fry the bacon in a pan until crispy.
Crack the eggs into the pan and cook to your desired doneness.
Season the eggs with salt and pepper, then serve with the crispy bacon.

Title: Garlic Butter Shrimp
Description: Shrimp saut√©ed in a rich garlic butter sauce.

Steps.Content: Peel and devein the shrimp.
Melt butter in a pan and saut√© garlic until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the pan and cook until pink and opaque.
Season with salt, pepper, and parsley before serving.

Title: Tomato Basil Soup
Description: A fresh and fragrant tomato basil soup.

Steps.Content: Chop the tomatoes, onion, and garlic.
Saut√© the onion and garlic in a pot with some oil until soft.
Add chopped tomatoes and vegetable stock to the pot and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and fresh basil.
Blend the soup until smooth, then serve hot.

Title: Carrot Soup
Description: A warm and healthy carrot soup.

Steps.Content: Peel and chop the carrots, onion, and garlic.
Saut√© the onion and garlic in a pot with some oil until soft.
Add chopped carrots and vegetable stock, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Blend the soup until smooth and serve hot.

Title: Rice Pilaf
Description: A flavorful rice pilaf with spices and vegetables.

Steps.Content: Chop the onion, garlic, and carrot.
Saut√© the onion, garlic, and carrot in a pot with some oil until soft.
Add the rice and soy sauce, then cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add 2 cups of water and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover.
Cook for 20 minutes, or until rice is tender and water is absorbed.

Title: Cheese Stuffed Mushrooms
Description: Mushrooms stuffed with cheese and baked to perfection.

Steps.Content: Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F).
Remove the stems from the mushrooms and chop them finely.
Saut√© the chopped mushroom stems and garlic in butter until soft.
Mix the saut√©ed mushrooms with cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Stuff the mushroom caps with the cheese mixture and place on a baking sheet.
Bake in the oven for 20 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the cheese is melted.

Title: Bacon Carbonara
Description: A creamy pasta carbonara with crispy bacon.

Steps.Content: Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
Fry the bacon in a pan until crispy, then remove and chop.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and Parmesan cheese.
Drain the cooked spaghetti and toss with the crispy bacon.
Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta and toss quickly to coat.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve immediately.

Title: Garlic Mashed Potatoes
Description: Creamy mashed potatoes with roasted garlic.

Steps.Content: Peel and chop the potatoes into chunks.
Roast the garlic cloves in the oven for 10 minutes.
Boil the potatoes in salted water until tender, about 15 minutes.
Mash the potatoes with butter, roasted garlic, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot.

Title: Spaghetti Bolognese
Description: A hearty spaghetti bolognese with minced beef and tomato sauce.

Steps.Content: Chop the onion, garlic, and tomatoes.
Cook the minced beef in a pan until browned.
Saut√© the onion and garlic in a separate pan until softened.
Add chopped tomatoes to the pan with the onions and garlic, and cook for 10 minutes.
Combine the browned beef with the tomato sauce, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions and drain.
Serve the Bolognese sauce over the cooked spaghetti.

Title: Carrot and Broccoli Stir-Fry
Description: A quick and healthy stir-fry with carrots and broccoli.

Steps.Content: Chop the carrot and broccoli into bite-sized pieces.
Heat the olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
Add the carrots and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add the broccoli and continue stir-frying for another 5 minutes.
Season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately.

Title: Milkshake
Description: A creamy and refreshing milkshake.

Steps.Content: Add milk, ice cream, and sugar to a blender.
Blend until smooth.
Serve immediately.

Title: BBQ Chicken
Description: Grilled chicken with a smoky BBQ sauce.

Steps.Content: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Grill the chicken for 6-7 minutes on each side.
Brush the chicken with BBQ sauce during the last 2 minutes of grilling.
Serve with additional BBQ sauce on the side.

Title: Classic Beef Stroganoff
Description: Tender beef strips in a creamy mushroom sauce, served over pasta.

Steps.Content: Saut√© onions and garlic in butter until translucent.
Add beef strips and cook until browned.
Stir in mushrooms and cook until softened.
Add sour cream, salt, and pepper, then simmer for a few minutes.
Serve over cooked pasta.

Title: Beef Tacos
Description: Seasoned ground beef served in crispy taco shells with fresh toppings.

Steps.Content: Saut√© onions and garlic until soft.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Season with cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Fill taco shells with beef and top with lettuce, tomato, and cheese.

Title: Grilled Steak with Garlic Butter
Description: Juicy grilled steak topped with garlic butter and served with vegetables.

Steps.Content: Season steaks with salt and pepper.
Grill steaks to desired doneness.
Melt butter with minced garlic and rosemary.
Pour garlic butter over steaks before serving.

Title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
Description: Tender beef slices stir-fried with broccoli in a savory sauce.

Steps.Content: Blanch broccoli in boiling water and set aside.
Saut√© garlic, then add beef slices and cook until browned.
Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cornstarch with water.
Add sauce and broccoli to the beef, stir-fry for 2 minutes.

Title: Slow Cooker Beef Stew
Description: A hearty and comforting beef stew cooked slowly for maximum flavor.

Steps.Content: Brown beef chunks in a pan.
Place beef, carrots, potatoes, onions, and garlic into a slow cooker.
Add beef broth, tomato paste, salt, pepper, and thyme.
Cook on low for 6 hours until tender.

Title: Spicy Beef Stir-Fry
Description: Tender beef slices stir-fried with red pepper and a spicy sauce.

Steps.Content: Slice red pepper into thin strips.
Saut√© garlic and red pepper in sesame oil until fragrant.
Add beef slices and cook until browned.
Mix soy sauce, chili flakes, and cornstarch with water, then add to the pan.
Stir-fry everything together and serve hot.

Title: Beef and Red Pepper Fajitas
Description: Juicy beef strips and red pepper saut√©ed with spices, served in warm tortillas.

Steps.Content: Slice red pepper and onion into strips.
Saut√© beef strips in a pan until browned.
Add red pepper, onion, cumin, and chili powder, then cook until tender.
Serve in warm tortillas with a squeeze of lime.

Title: Red Pepper Pasta
Description: Creamy roasted red pepper sauce served over pasta.

Steps.Content: Roast red peppers in the oven until skin is charred, then peel.
Blend roasted peppers with garlic, onion, and heavy cream.
Cook pasta according to package instructions.
Toss pasta with red pepper sauce and top with Parmesan cheese.

Title: Spicy Red Pepper Hummus
Description: A flavorful hummus dip made with roasted red pepper and chickpeas.

Steps.Content: Roast red pepper in the oven until charred, then peel and chop.
Blend red pepper, chickpeas, tahini, garlic, lemon juice, and salt until smooth.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika before serving.

Title: Stuffed Red Peppers
Description: Bell peppers stuffed with a flavorful rice and vegetable mixture.

Steps.Content: Cut the tops off red peppers and remove the seeds.
Cook rice and mix with saut√©ed onion, carrot, garlic, and tomato.
Stuff the peppers with the rice mixture.
Bake in the oven at 180¬∞C for 30 minutes.

Title: Taiwanese Golden Pickled Cabbage
Description: Taiwanese Golden Pickled Cabbage is a delicious and refreshing Taiwanese-style side dish that is easy to find in many places.Unlike Korean kimchi, Golden Pickled Cabbage isn‚Äôt fermented. Instead, it is marinated with fermented bean curd as a key ingredient in the sauce, along with garlic, vinegar, apple, and carrot, which give it its signature golden color. Its flavor is fruity, refreshing, and rich, making it a perfect pairing with rice, noodles, or grilled dishes. It‚Äôs light, tasty, and adds a refreshing touch to any meal!

Steps.Content: Rinse the cabbage and chop it into large chunks.
Add salt equal to 3% of the total cabbage weight (15g). Mix well until the cabbage starts to soften slightly, then let it sit for 30 minutes.
Now, let's make the marinade: Chop the carrot and apple into chunks. Place the rest of the ingredients into a food processor or use an immersion blender to blend them into a puree.
Make sure to do a taste test and season to your liking.

Gently squeeze the cabbage after resting to remove excess water. (Remember to do a taste test! If you prefer a milder flavor, you can quickly rinse the cabbage with drinking water to wash away some of the salt.)
Mix the cabbage with the marinade, ensuring it‚Äôs evenly coated.

Title: Sauteed Cabbage
Description: A simple and delicious stir-fried cabbage dish with glass noodles, eggs, and carrots, seasoned with soy sauce and aromatics.

Steps.Content: Wash the cabbage well, then slice it and remove the hard part. Peel the carrot and slice it. Soak the glass noodles.
Heat the pan, add oil, then scramble the eggs. Set aside.
In the same pan, add oil, then drop in the garlic and shallots. Stir-fry until fragrant.
Add the cabbage and carrot, mix well, then add a little water. Cover and simmer.
When the cabbage is almost half-cooked, add in the soaked glass noodles and season with soy sauce. Mix, cover, and cook until done.

Title: California Farm Red Cabbage Sauerkraut
Description: Red Cabbage, sweet red apples, strong yellow onions, special spices, you will love this red cabbage sauerkraut. As a cold summer salad or mixed with mashed potatoes to make a warm meal. The special spices used are available on the internet, but here is the recipe to make them yourself anytime.
Ingredients: 1 small red cabbage (2 lbs after removing core and outer leaves)

Steps.Content: Make the spice blend. You only need two tablespoons for this recipe, but it's best to prepare a small jar for future use. Grind together: 8 tsp cinnamon, 2 tsp nutmeg, 1 tsp each ginger, star anise, mace, cardamom, cloves, pepper, and coriander.

Use a large plastic tub with a lid to keep insects out. Use a mandolin or sharp knife to shred the cabbage, apples, and onions. Place them in the tub, add salt and spices, and let stand for 10 minutes. The mix will start to release its juices.
Take a handful of the mixture and squeeze it between your hands until the apples release their juice.
You can also use a home wine press or a wooden mallet to bruise (but not pulverize) the vegetables.
Find a lid or plate that fits inside the tub to keep the sauerkraut submerged for fermentation. Use weights like boiled rocks if needed. The sauerkraut juice will turn purple.
Keep the tub covered to prevent insects. The sauerkraut is ready in 3 days and reaches peak flavor in 6 weeks. To stop fermentation, refrigerate or store in a cool basement. Stays fresh for a year.

Title: Warm Red Cabbage Slaw
Description: This recipe was inspired by Skunkmonkey101‚Äôs Warm Red Cabbage Salad. I modified it a little and added a sweet onion. Very tasty side.
Ingredients: 1 small head red cabbage (1.5 lbs), core removed and sliced thinly

Steps.Content: In a large skillet, cook the bacon until crispy. Transfer the cooked bacon to a plate lined with a paper towel to drain. Crumble the bacon.

Add sliced onion to the skillet and cook until just barely softened. Add vinegar, sugar, and black pepper. Mix well and add in the cabbage. Cook until just wilted but still slightly firm. Cover the skillet if needed to help wilt the cabbage. Mix in crumbled bacon.
Serve warm and enjoy!

Title: Pumpkin Chicken Chili
Description: Bit of a mix of two recipes from A Taste of Home' soups stews and more with my own tweaks
Ingredients: 1 cup grated mild white cheese (Asiago, Havarti, or Gouda)

Steps.Content: Take the cup of dried beans, cover with water, and let sit overnight.
Dice the chicken into small cubes or process it in a food processor.
Dice the onion. Melt butter in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the onion and stir occasionally until it sweats. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds).
Once the veggies are cooked, add in the diced chicken. When the chicken is halfway cooked, add all spices except for the bay leaf. Cook until the chicken is done.
Pour in diced tomatoes and green chilis with their juices. Cook, stirring constantly, until the juices are reduced by half.
Turn to high heat. Add chicken broth, half and half, pumpkin puree, and beans. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for 30 minutes, stirring once halfway through.

At the 30-minute mark, add in the bay leaf and cheese. Stir well and continue cooking, stirring every 15 minutes, until the chili thickens to the desired consistency (about 45 more minutes). Adjust salt to taste.
Serve with optional shredded cheddar or white cheddar, sour cream, and enjoy!

Title: üçÇüéÉ Pumpkin Soup üéÉüçÇ
Description: A warm and creamy pumpkin soup, perfect for the transition from fall to winter. Made with roasted squash, fresh herbs, and a hint of coconut milk.

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F. Cut the butternut squash lengthwise and peel/cut the acorn squash into pieces. Gather the remaining vegetables (carrots, onion, garlic, tomato).
Place pumpkin and vegetables on a baking tray. Sprinkle thyme, salt, and pepper evenly. Add sage leaves and drizzle generously with olive oil.
Bake for 30 minutes. After 30 minutes, cover with aluminum foil and bake for another 10 minutes.
Using a spoon, scoop out the pumpkin from the skin. In batches, add pumpkin, vegetables, and vegetable broth to a blender. Blend until smooth. Adjust broth amount for desired consistency.
Transfer the blended soup to a pot and bring to a boil. Add coconut milk and stir. Once bubbling, turn off heat and set aside.
Serve with a grilled cheese sandwich or buttered toast. Enjoy! üòã

Title: Cauliflower Steak (or Tofu Slices) with Chimichurri and Feta
Description: A vibrant and flavorful dish featuring roasted cauliflower or tofu, topped with a fresh chimichurri sauce and creamy feta.
Ingredients: 1 medium cauliflower (or 1 block of extra-firm tofu)

Steps.Content: Cut the cauliflower or tofu into thick slices. Mix the honey, chili powder, and soy sauce to create a marinade. Coat the slices and let them marinate.
Mix lemon juice and garlic, and let rest for 10 minutes. Then, combine with the remaining chimichurri sauce ingredients.
Blend the feta cream ingredients together until somewhat smooth.
Heat butter and olive oil in a frying pan. Saut√© the cauliflower or tofu slices until they are tender and golden brown.

On a plate, spread the feta cream. Place a slice of roasted cauliflower or tofu on top. Add chimichurri sauce, then sprinkle with crumbled feta and sun-dried tomatoes. Drizzle extra-virgin olive oil and serve immediately.

Title: Cauliflower and Broccoli
Description: A simple and healthy dish featuring boiled cauliflower and broccoli with garlic and ginger for extra flavor.

Steps.Content: Wash the broccoli and cauliflower thoroughly. Cut them into small florets.
Bring 2 glasses of water to a boil in a pot. Add garlic, ginger, and salt.
Add the cauliflower and broccoli to the boiling water. Cook until they are tender but still slightly crisp.
Drain the vegetables and serve warm.

Title: Broccoli Cheddar Risotto
Description: An easy and delicious weeknight meal featuring creamy risotto with broccoli and cheddar cheese.

Steps.Content: In one pan, melt the butter with salt and pepper on medium heat. In a separate pan, keep the chicken broth warm over low heat.
Chop the broccoli into bite-sized pieces.
Add Arborio rice to the buttered pan and cook until aromatic, about 3 minutes.
Slowly add one scoop of warm broth at a time to the risotto, stirring continuously. Allow each scoop to fully absorb before adding more. Repeat until all broth is used (about 20 minutes).
Add broccoli and cheddar cheese to the risotto. Stir and cook together for another 5 minutes.

Title: Burrata and Cherry Tomato Gnocchi
Description: My favorite gnocchi recipe and so easy for anyone to recreate!

Steps.Content: Cook the garlic on medium heat for 3 minutes. Add in cherry tomatoes and occasionally mix until jam-like (about 12 minutes).
In a separate pot, prepare the gnocchi according to the package instructions. Save one cup of the pasta water before straining.
Add heavy cream, salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning to the cherry tomato mixture and stir well.
Add Burrata, cooked gnocchi, reserved pasta water, and fresh basil. Optionally, top with red pepper flakes for extra heat.

Title: Cherry Tomato Feta Pasta
Description: A simple yet delicious pasta dish with roasted cherry tomatoes, garlic, and feta cheese.

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Mix cherry tomatoes, whole garlic cloves, oregano, olive oil, salt, and pepper in a baking dish.
Place the block of feta cheese in the center of the baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle more oregano on top.
Bake for 25 minutes. At the same time, boil the pasta according to package instructions.
Remove the baking dish from the oven. Peel and mash the roasted garlic, then mix it with the cherry tomatoes and melted feta.
Add the cooked pasta and toss everything together. If needed, add 1/2 cup of reserved pasta water to blend the sauce. Garnish with fresh basil and serve.

Title: Cherry Tomato Baked Cod
Description: Buttery, flakey, and juicy cod with sweet and tart cherry tomatoes! The garlic herb butter definitely brings the cod to the next level! Try it for a busy weekday dinner!

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C).
Use a paper towel to pat dry the cod fillets.
Cut the cherry tomatoes in half. Place them in a baking dish along with the cod fillets.
In a small bowl, mix together butter, olive oil, salt, paprika, chopped garlic, parsley, and lemon juice.
Spread the seasoning mixture evenly over the cod fillets. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the cod is cooked through and flaky.
Serve hot and enjoy your delicious Cherry Tomato Baked Cod!

Title: Best Baked Salmon
Description: A simple and flavorful baked salmon recipe with butter, lemon, and fresh herbs.

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C).
Let salmon come to room temperature for 15 minutes.
In a small bowl, mix melted butter and lemon juice. Brush the mixture over the salmon fillets.
Top the salmon with minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes, or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with fresh parsley and dill before serving. Enjoy!

Title: Salmon Sushi Cups
Description: Easy and delicious baked salmon sushi cups with crispy nori and creamy yum yum sauce.
Ingredients: Yum Yum sauce (I use G Hughes)

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). Use kitchen scissors to cut 2 seaweed sheets into 4 pieces each, making 8 total. Cut salmon into cubes.
Using a muffin tin, add squares of seaweed, top with a spoonful of rice, then top with cubed salmon. Spray each sushi cup lightly with avocado oil.
Bake for 20 minutes. Top with yum yum sauce and optionally avocado. Enjoy!

Title: Snakehead Fish with Green Pea and Tomato Curry
Description: A flavorful Bengali-style curry with snakehead fish, green peas, and tomatoes.

Steps.Content: Heat oil in a frypan. Add chopped onions and salt, frying for 1 minute. Add ginger garlic paste and fry for another minute. Then add tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and some water. Cover and saut√© until oil separates.
Add boiled peas and Snakehead fish into the pan. Stir-fry on low flame for 5 minutes while covered.
Add boiled water as needed and cook for 3-4 minutes on medium-high flame.
Once the fish is fully cooked, add green chilies, chopped tomatoes, and coriander leaves on top.
Cover the pan and cook for 2 more minutes to infuse flavors.
Turn off the heat. Serve hot with steamed rice and enjoy this delicious Bengali delicacy.

Title: Grilled Snakehead Fish
Description: A delicious and aromatic grilled fish dish infused with turmeric, lemongrass, and dill.

Steps.Content: Clean the fish thoroughly, rub with salt, and rinse well. Cut into smaller pieces. Finely chop galangal, lemongrass, garlic, chili, and shallots. Chop most of the dill, leaving some whole leaves aside.

Prepare the marinade: mix turmeric powder, chopped galangal, lemongrass, garlic, chili, shallots, chopped dill, seasoning powder, MSG, a little cooking oil, and a bit of fish sauce. Marinate the fish for 20 minutes.

Preheat the oven or air fryer. Place a sheet of aluminum foil on the tray, arrange the fish on top, and pour the remaining marinade over it. Add a few whole dill sprigs. Grill in two stages: 200¬∞C for 10 minutes, then flip and continue at 130¬∞C for another 10 minutes, adjusting as needed until golden brown and cooked through.
Prepare the dipping sauce: finely chop garlic, chili, and a little dill. Mix with sugar, fresh lime juice, and fish sauce to taste. Enjoy the grilled fish with this flavorful sauce!

Title: Carrot Cake Blended Overnight Oats
Description: A creamy, delicious breakfast treat that tastes just like carrot cake! Perfect for a quick and nutritious morning meal.
Ingredients: 1/2 tablespoon agave or sweetener of choice

Steps.Content: Add the oats, milk, cottage cheese, baby carrots, and 1/4 cup vanilla Greek yogurt to a blender. Blend until smooth.
Add the cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and sweetener to the blender. Blend again until all the seasonings are fully incorporated.
Pour the mixture into a container of choice and top with the remaining vanilla Greek yogurt.
Let sit in the fridge for at least 3 hours before enjoying!

Title: Eggplant üçÜ with Tahini and Chickpeas
Description: A delicious and nutritious dish made with roasted eggplants, chickpeas, and tahini. Perfect for a healthy meal!

Steps.Content: Soak chickpeas overnight and cook them until tender.
Preheat the oven to 400¬∞F. Wash the eggplants and poke them with a fork. Bake for 30-40 minutes until soft.
Peel the roasted eggplants and dice them.
Mix diced eggplants with cooked chickpeas. Add lemon juice, tahini, tamari sauce, finely shredded ginger, chopped parsley, black pepper, and salt to taste. Store the mixture until ready to serve.
Before serving, add 1 chopped tomato and 2 cucumbers per serving. Adjust salt and pepper to taste.

Title: California Farm Venison Eggplant Moussaka
Description: Lean flavorfull meat like ground lamb or ground venison, deer meat, is a great way to make a three layer greek moussaka with eggplant. A delicacy, usually only available to hunters. New Zealand Farmers now sell excellent frozen venison worldwide.
Ingredients: 4 tbsp California extra virgin olive oil
2 tbsp California extra virgin olive oil
1 heaping tbsp Greek Bechamel sauce flour (like cake flour)

Steps.Content: Slice eggplant into 1/4‚Äù thick slices, keeping the peel on. Salt the slices and let them sit for 30 minutes to remove bitterness. Rinse and pat dry.
Spray eggplant slices with olive oil. Broil or bake until they develop color, but keep them soft, not crispy.
Prepare Greek Bechamel sauce: In a pan, fry flour with pepper and nutmeg in oil. Gradually whisk in cream until smooth. Whisk in eggs and cook until thickened.
Make the moussaka sauce: Fry diced onions and tomatoes with oregano, cinnamon, and paprika in olive oil. Add wine, broth, and sugar. Reduce the sauce until thickened.
Brown the ground venison in the moussaka sauce, stirring until the meat is fully cooked and the sauce is rich.
Assemble the moussaka in layers in a deep baking dish: 1/3 eggplant, 1/3 meat sauce, 1/3 Bechamel. Repeat twice. Sprinkle breadcrumbs on top.
Bake at 350¬∞F for 45 minutes. Broil the top until crispy. Let rest for 15 minutes before serving. Enjoy!

Title: Baked Lemon Herb Catfish
Description: A light and fresh alternative to fried catfish, baked with butter, lemon, and garden herbs for a flavorful dish.
Ingredients: 1 Tbsp fresh herbs, finely chopped (parsley, oregano, thyme)

Steps.Content: Mix the fresh herbs, black pepper, salt, and garlic sriracha seasoning. Apply the mixture evenly to both sides of the catfish fillet.
Preheat oven to 350¬∞F. Line a small baking pan with non-stick foil and spray with cooking spray.
Place the seasoned fish in the prepared pan. Mix the melted butter and lemon juice together, then pour over the fish.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until the fish flakes easily and reaches an internal temperature of 150¬∞F. Plate the fish and spoon the butter-lemon sauce over it. Serve with your choice of sides and enjoy!

Title: Southern Fried Catfish
Description: Crispy, golden-brown catfish fried to perfection with a flavorful cornmeal coating.

Steps.Content: Place the catfish fillets in a bowl with buttermilk and refrigerate for an hour.
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat until it reaches the right frying temperature.
In a separate bowl, mix cornmeal, flour, and all seasonings until well combined.
Remove the catfish from the refrigerator, pour some mustard over it, and mix well. Dredge each fillet in the seasoned cornmeal mixture.
Fry each fillet for about 3 minutes on one side, then flip and continue cooking for 2 more minutes, until golden and crispy.
Remove from skillet, let cool slightly, garnish with parsley, and serve hot. Enjoy!

Title: Pecan Sauce Catfish
Description: Delicious catfish cooked in a flavorful pecan-based sauce with aromatic spices and basil.

Steps.Content: Mix the fish spices with a little bit of water to create a seasoning paste.
Use the spice mix to season the catfish evenly.
Fry the catfish until it is half-cooked, then set it aside.
Blend the red chili peppers, garlic, onions, and candlenuts into a smooth paste, then stir-fry until the color changes.
Add a glass of water and a pinch of salt to the stir-fried spice mixture and bring it to a boil.
Once the sauce is boiling, add the catfish back into the pan and let it cook through.
Add fresh basil leaves at the end for extra aroma and flavor.

Title: Stuffed Celery
Description: A simple and refreshing appetizer made with crisp celery, sweet pickles, and creamy cheese.

Steps.Content: Crisp celery in cold water. Chop sweet pickles combine wit cream cheese. Spread mixture in celery.

Title: Buttered Beef Broth with Celery
Description: A warm and comforting buttered beef broth infused with celery and spices, perfect for soothing the senses.

Steps.Content: My sinuses have been acting up really bad due to the weather changes. So it was craving these flavors. Then I was not feeling so well last night. So, I took the celery and chopped it into a bunch of little pieces, along with the leaves. Then I took, the half stick of butter and salt and melted it. I sauteed the celery inside the butter so it was a little bit soft. Then I added the rest of the spices.
After the celery was tender, I added the beef broth, and simmered it along with the vinegar, for about 15 minutes. Serve hot, I hope you enjoy!!!

Title: Saut√©ed King Trumpet Mushrooms with Garlic
Description: A simple dish highlighting the robust flavor of king trumpet mushrooms saut√©ed with garlic and herbs.

Steps.Content: Clean and slice the mushrooms.
Heat olive oil in a pan and saut√© minced garlic until fragrant.
Add mushrooms and cook until tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and garnish with parsley.

Title: King Trumpet Mushroom Risotto
Description: A creamy risotto featuring king trumpet mushrooms for a savory and satisfying meal.

Steps.Content: Saut√© chopped onion in butter until translucent.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook until soft.
Stir in rice and toast for 2 minutes.
Gradually add broth and wine, stirring constantly until creamy.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Title: Shiitake Mushroom Stir-Fry
Description: A quick stir-fry with shiitake mushrooms and vegetables, perfect for a healthy meal.

Steps.Content: Slice shiitake mushrooms and bell pepper.
Heat sesame oil in a wok; add garlic and ginger.
Add mushrooms and bell pepper, stir-frying for 5 minutes.
Drizzle with soy sauce and cook for 2 more minutes.

Title: Shiitake Mushroom Soup
Description: A warming soup featuring shiitake mushrooms and aromatic herbs.

Steps.Content: Saut√© chopped onion and garlic until softened.
Add sliced shiitake mushrooms and cook for 3 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth and soy sauce; simmer for 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Title: Enoki Mushroom Tempura
Description: Crispy tempura featuring delicate enoki mushrooms served with a light dipping sauce.

Steps.Content: Prepare the tempura batter according to package instructions.
Dip enoki mushrooms into the batter.
Deep fry in hot oil until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.

Title: Enoki Mushroom Salad
Description: A refreshing salad with enoki mushrooms and mixed greens dressed in a light vinaigrette.

Steps.Content: Clean enoki mushrooms and trim the ends.
Combine mushrooms with mixed greens in a bowl.
Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice, then toss to combine.
Season with salt and pepper.

Title: Black Fungus Salad
Description: A tangy and refreshing salad featuring crisp black fungus.

Steps.Content: Soak black fungus in warm water until softened, then drain.
Slice cucumber into thin julienne strips.
Toss black fungus and cucumber with rice vinegar, sugar, and salt.

Title: Black Fungus Stir-Fry with Vegetables
Description: A quick stir-fry combining black fungus with colorful vegetables.

Steps.Content: Prepare black fungus by soaking and slicing it.
Julienne the carrot and slice the bell pepper.
Stir-fry all ingredients in sesame oil over high heat.
Add soy sauce and season with salt and pepper.

Title: Garlic Butter Flower Snails
Description: Tender flower snails saut√©ed in garlic butter‚Äîa delicacy for seafood lovers.

Steps.Content: Clean the flower snails thoroughly.
Melt butter in a pan and saut√© minced garlic until fragrant.
Add flower snails and cook until heated through.
Drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.

Title: Spicy Flower Snail Stew
Description: A hearty stew with flower snails simmered in a spicy tomato-based sauce.

Steps.Content: Saut√© chopped onion and garlic until soft.
Add flower snails and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in diced tomatoes and add chili flakes.
Simmer for 25 minutes and season with salt and pepper.

Title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
Description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with a savory mix of rice, meat, and vegetables.

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 375¬∞F.
Hollow out bell peppers.
Mix cooked rice, ground beef, onion, and tomato.
Stuff peppers with the mixture and bake for 25 minutes.

Title: Bell Pepper Fajitas
Description: Sizzling bell pepper fajitas with onions and marinated chicken‚Äîperfect for a quick dinner.

Steps.Content: Slice bell peppers and onion into strips.
Toss chicken with fajita seasoning.
Saut√© chicken until nearly cooked, then add vegetables.
Cook for an additional 5 minutes until vegetables soften.

Title: Lemongrass Chicken Soup
Description: A fragrant chicken soup infused with lemongrass and fresh herbs for a warming meal.

Steps.Content: Bruise lemongrass and simmer in chicken broth.
Add chopped onion, garlic, and chicken thighs.
Simmer for 20 minutes until chicken is cooked.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Title: Grilled Lemongrass Beef Skewers
Description: Tender beef skewers marinated with lemongrass and grilled to perfection.

Steps.Content: Marinate beef with lemongrass, garlic, soy sauce, and olive oil.
Skewer the beef cubes and grill for 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Title: BBQ Pork Ribs
Description: Succulent pork ribs slathered in barbecue sauce and slow-cooked to perfection.

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 300¬∞F.
Season pork ribs with salt, pepper, brown sugar, and paprika.
Coat ribs with BBQ sauce and bake for 2 hours.
Finish under the broiler for 5 minutes to caramelize the sauce.

Title: Slow Cooked Pork Ribs
Description: Tender pork ribs slow cooked in a rich, savory sauce for an unforgettable flavor.

Steps.Content: Season pork ribs with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
Combine tomato sauce and vinegar in a slow cooker.
Add ribs and cook on low for 3 hours.
Serve with extra sauce drizzled on top.

Title: Spicy Korean Pork Ribs
Description: Korean-style pork ribs with a spicy gochujang glaze, delivering a sweet, savory, and fiery kick.

Steps.Content: Cut the pork ribs into individual pieces or smaller sections.
In a bowl, whisk together gochujang, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, sesame oil, minced garlic, and grated ginger to create the marinade.
Marinate the ribs in the mixture for at least 30 minutes (or up to overnight in the refrigerator).
Preheat oven to 350¬∞F (175¬∞C).
Arrange ribs on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 45-60 minutes, basting with the marinade every 15 minutes, until ribs are cooked through and tender.
Optional: Finish under the broiler for a few minutes for extra char.
Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.

Title: Honey Garlic Glazed Pork Ribs
Description: Pork ribs coated in a sticky and sweet honey garlic glaze, baked until caramelized and delicious.

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 325¬∞F (160¬∞C).
Season pork ribs generously with salt and pepper.
Place ribs in a baking dish.
In a small bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce, minced garlic, rice vinegar, grated ginger, and red pepper flakes (if using).
Pour half of the honey garlic glaze over the ribs, ensuring they are well coated.
Cover the baking dish with foil and bake for 1.5 hours.
Remove foil, baste with the remaining glaze, and bake uncovered for another 30-45 minutes, or until ribs are tender and the glaze is caramelized.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Title: Beef Stroganoff
Description: Classic beef stroganoff with tender strips of beef in a creamy mushroom sauce.

Steps.Content: Saut√© beef strips until browned.
Add onions and mushrooms; cook until softened.
Stir in flour and beef broth; simmer for 15 minutes.
Mix in sour cream and heat through.

Title: Grilled Beef Steak with Herbs
Description: Juicy beef steak grilled with a mix of fresh herbs for a flavorful meal.

Steps.Content: Marinate steak with olive oil, garlic, rosemary, and thyme.
Grill steak to desired doneness.
Let rest for 5 minutes, then slice and serve.

Title: Ground Pork Dumplings
Description: Delicious dumplings filled with seasoned ground pork, perfect for dipping.

Steps.Content: Mix ground pork with shredded cabbage, garlic, and soy sauce.
Fill dumpling wrappers with the mixture and fold tightly.
Steam dumplings for 15 minutes.
Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Title: Spicy Ground Pork Noodles
Description: A hearty noodle dish tossed with spicy ground pork and crisp vegetables.

Steps.Content: Cook noodles according to package instructions.
Saut√© ground pork with sliced onion and bell pepper until browned.
Mix in chili garlic sauce and soy sauce, then toss with noodles.
Serve hot.

Title: Chicken Heart Skewers
Description: Grilled chicken hearts marinated in a tangy sauce and skewered for an adventurous appetizer.

Steps.Content: Clean and marinate chicken hearts with soy sauce, olive oil, and garlic.
Skewer the hearts evenly.
Grill for 15 minutes until charred and tender.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Title: Saut√©ed Chicken Hearts with Herbs
Description: Tender chicken hearts quickly saut√©ed with fresh herbs‚Äîa unique and savory appetizer.

Steps.Content: Clean and slice chicken hearts.
Heat olive oil in a pan and saut√© garlic until fragrant.
Add chicken hearts and thyme; cook until tender.
Season with salt and pepper before serving.

Title: Garlic Shrimp Pasta
Description: A quick pasta dish tossed with garlic, succulent shrimp, and fresh herbs.

Steps.Content: Cook pasta until al dente and set aside.
Saut√© garlic in olive oil until fragrant.
Add shrimp and cook until they turn pink.
Toss pasta with shrimp, drizzle lemon juice, and season to taste.

Title: Spicy Shrimp Tacos
Description: Tacos filled with spicy shrimp, crisp slaw, and a zesty lime dressing.

Steps.Content: Season shrimp with chili powder and salt.
Saut√© shrimp in olive oil until cooked through.
Assemble tacos with shrimp, cabbage slaw, and a squeeze of lime.

Title: Coconut Curry Shrimp
Description: Tender shrimp simmered in a fragrant and creamy coconut curry sauce, served with rice.

Steps.Content: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Add chopped onion and saut√© until softened, about 3 minutes.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger, and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Stir in the red curry paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add the sliced bell pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in the fish sauce (or soy sauce) and brown sugar.
Add the shrimp and cook until they turn pink and are cooked through, about 3-5 minutes.
Stir in the lime juice.
Serve hot over cooked rice, garnished with fresh cilantro.

Title: Shrimp Scampi with Zucchini Noodles
Description: A lighter take on classic shrimp scampi, using zucchini noodles instead of pasta for a healthy and flavorful meal.
Ingredients: 1/4 cup Dry White Wine (like Sauvignon Blanc or Pinot Grigio)
Salt and Black Pepper, to taste

Steps.Content: Spiralize the zucchinis into noodles. If you don't have a spiralizer, use a vegetable peeler to create long, thin ribbons.
Pat the zucchini noodles dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture. This will help them cook better.
Heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Don't let it burn.
Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until pink and cooked through.
Pour in the white wine and let it simmer for a minute, allowing the alcohol to evaporate.
Add the zucchini noodles to the skillet and toss gently to coat them with the sauce. Cook for 2-3 minutes, until they are slightly softened but still have some bite.
Stir in the lemon juice, chopped parsley, and red pepper flakes (if using).
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve immediately.

Title: Crispy Lettuce Wraps
Description: Fresh lettuce leaves filled with a savory mix of vegetables and ground pork for a light meal.

Steps.Content: Cook ground pork with diced carrot and bell pepper until browned.
Season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper.
Spoon the mixture into crisp lettuce leaves and serve.

Title: Lettuce Caesar Salad
Description: A refreshing twist on the classic Caesar salad using crisp lettuce and a tangy dressing.

Steps.Content: Toss chopped lettuce with Caesar dressing.
Top with grated Parmesan cheese and croutons.
Season lightly with salt and pepper.

Title: Stir-Fried Chicken with Bitter Melon
Description: A delicious and slightly bitter stir-fried chicken with bitter melon, a classic Vietnamese dish.

Steps.Content: Slice the bitter melon thinly and soak in salted water for 10 minutes, then drain.
Heat oil in a pan and saut√© garlic and shallot until fragrant.
Add the chicken slices and stir-fry until cooked through.
Add the bitter melon and stir-fry for another 3-5 minutes.
Season with fish sauce, sugar, salt, and black pepper. Stir well.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

Title: Chicken Soup with Bamboo Shoots
Description: A hearty and aromatic chicken soup with bamboo shoots, perfect for a comforting meal.

Steps.Content: Boil the chicken in water for 5 minutes, then discard the water and rinse the chicken.
Heat oil in a pot and saut√© shallot, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add the chicken and stir-fry for a few minutes until slightly browned.
Pour in water and bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
Add bamboo shoots and season with salt, pepper, and fish sauce.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes until chicken is tender.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

Title: Grilled Lemongrass Chicken
Description: A flavorful grilled chicken marinated with lemongrass, garlic, and fish sauce.

Steps.Content: In a bowl, mix lemongrass, garlic, shallot, fish sauce, black pepper, sugar, and oil.
Marinate chicken with the mixture for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat grill or pan over medium heat.
Grill the chicken for 5-7 minutes per side until fully cooked.
Serve hot with steamed rice or fresh vegetables.

Title: Stewed Silkie Chicken with Chinese Herbs
Description: A nutritious and flavorful stewed Silkie chicken with traditional Chinese herbs.
Ingredients: 1 Silkie Chicken (whole, cleaned and cut into pieces)

Steps.Content: Heat oil in a pot and saut√© shallots, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add Silkie chicken and stir-fry for a few minutes until slightly browned.
Pour in water and bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and black pepper.
Simmer for 60-90 minutes until the chicken is tender and the broth is flavorful.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

Title: Steamed Black Chicken with Ginseng
Description: A nourishing dish with black chicken and ginseng, known for its health benefits.
Ingredients: 1 whole Black Chicken (cleaned and cut in half)

Steps.Content: Rinse the black chicken and blanch in boiling water for 3 minutes.
In a clay pot, add the chicken, ginseng, red dates, goji berries, mushrooms, and ginger.
Pour in water and bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 60 minutes.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and black pepper.
Serve hot with rice or enjoy as a tonic soup.

Title: Stir-fried Rice Noodles with Shrimp and Bean Sprouts
Description: A delicious stir-fried rice noodle dish with shrimp, eggs, and fresh bean sprouts.

Steps.Content: Soak the rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes, then drain.
Heat oil in a pan and saut√© garlic and shallots until fragrant.
Add shrimp and stir-fry until they turn pink.
Push the shrimp aside and crack the egg into the pan, scrambling it lightly.
Add the softened rice noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, and pepper. Stir-fry until well combined.
Toss in the bean sprouts and chives, stir-frying for another minute.
Serve hot with lime wedges on the side.

Title: Stir-Fried Bean Sprouts with Shrimp
Description: A quick and delicious stir-fried dish with fresh bean sprouts and shrimp.

Steps.Content: Heat oil in a pan and saut√© garlic and shallot until fragrant.
Add shrimp and stir-fry until pink and cooked through.
Add bean sprouts, fish sauce, sugar, and black pepper. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

Title: Steamed Chicken with Ginger
Description: A flavorful and aromatic steamed chicken dish with fresh ginger.

Steps.Content: Marinate chicken with soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, black pepper, and sesame oil for 15 minutes.
Arrange chicken on a steaming plate and top with sliced ginger and shallots.
Steam over high heat for 20 minutes until chicken is fully cooked.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

Title: Caramelized Catfish with Ginger
Description: A rich and savory Vietnamese-style caramelized catfish dish infused with ginger.

Steps.Content: Heat oil in a pan, add sugar, and stir until it caramelizes.
Add catfish and sear on both sides until golden.
Add minced shallots and julienned ginger, stir for a few seconds.
Pour in fish sauce, soy sauce, and coconut water, then simmer for 30 minutes until sauce thickens.
Sprinkle black pepper and serve hot with rice.

Title: Steamed Egg with Green Onion
Description: A soft and silky steamed egg dish with fragrant green onions.

Steps.Content: Beat the eggs gently in a bowl without making too many bubbles.
Mix in water, salt, fish sauce, and white pepper, then strain the mixture for a smooth texture.
Pour the egg mixture into a heatproof bowl, cover with foil, and steam on low heat for 10 minutes.
Drizzle a little oil on top, sprinkle with chopped green onions, and steam for another 2 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or as a side dish.

Title: Grilled Shrimp with Green Onion Oil
Description: Delicious grilled shrimp brushed with fragrant green onion oil.

Steps.Content: Clean the shrimp and pat them dry.
Season with salt, pepper, and fish sauce. Let marinate for 10 minutes.
Grill the shrimp over medium heat until fully cooked, about 3-4 minutes per side.
In a pan, heat oil and add the chopped green onion, stirring for a few seconds until fragrant.
Brush the green onion oil over the grilled shrimp and serve immediately.

Title: Vietnamese Pickled Shallots
Description: Tangy and slightly sweet Vietnamese-style pickled shallots, perfect as a side dish.

Steps.Content: Peel and clean the shallots. Soak them in warm water for 10 minutes to reduce sharpness.
In a pot, combine vinegar, water, sugar, and salt. Heat until the sugar dissolves, then let cool.
Place the shallots in a clean jar and pour the pickling liquid over them.
Add sliced chili if desired. Close the jar tightly and store at room temperature for 3 days before serving.

Title: Stuffed Bitter Melon Soup
Description: A comforting soup featuring bitter melon stuffed with seasoned ground pork, simmered in a flavorful broth.
Ingredients: 2 Bitter melons (cut into 5cm sections, hollowed out)

Steps.Content: In a bowl, mix ground pork, shallots, fish sauce, black pepper, sugar, and salt.
Stuff the seasoned ground pork mixture into the hollowed-out bitter melon sections.
Heat oil in a pot, add minced shallots, and saut√© until fragrant.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a gentle boil.
Add the stuffed bitter melon and simmer for 30 minutes until tender.
Adjust seasoning with salt or fish sauce to taste. Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.

Title: Stir-Fried Bitter Melon with Eggs
Description: A quick and nutritious dish featuring thinly sliced bitter melon stir-fried with eggs and seasoned for a balanced taste.

Steps.Content: Slice the bitter melon thinly and soak in salted water for 10 minutes to reduce bitterness. Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a pan, add shallots, and saut√© until fragrant.
Add the bitter melon and stir-fry for 3‚Äì4 minutes until slightly softened.
Pour in the beaten eggs and stir quickly to coat the bitter melon evenly.
Season with fish sauce, sugar, and black pepper. Stir until the eggs are fully cooked.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

Title: Bitter Melon Soup with Pork Ribs
Description: A comforting and nutritious soup featuring tender pork ribs and bitter melon, simmered to perfection.

Steps.Content: Blanch the pork ribs in boiling water for 5 minutes to remove impurities, then rinse with clean water.
In a pot, add water and bring it to a boil. Add the cleaned pork ribs and simmer for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, cut the bitter melon into chunks and remove the seeds.
Add the bitter melon to the soup and continue simmering for another 20 minutes until tender.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and black pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

Title: Taro and Pork Rib Soup
Description: A hearty and creamy soup with tender pork ribs and soft taro, perfect for a comforting meal.

Steps.Content: Blanch the pork ribs in boiling water for 5 minutes to remove impurities, then rinse with clean water.
In a pot, add water and bring it to a boil. Add the cleaned pork ribs and simmer for 30 minutes.
Add the taro pieces and continue simmering for another 20 minutes until soft.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and black pepper to taste.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot.

Title: Taro and Chicken Curry
Description: A rich and creamy chicken curry with tender taro, infused with aromatic spices and coconut milk.

Steps.Content: Heat oil in a pot, saut√© shallots and garlic until fragrant.
Add curry powder and stir for 30 seconds to release the aroma.
Add chicken pieces, season with fish sauce, salt, and black pepper. Stir-fry until chicken is browned.
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Simmer for 30 minutes until the chicken is tender.
Add taro and continue simmering for 15-20 minutes until the taro is soft.
Pour in coconut milk and stir well. Let it simmer for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve hot with steamed rice or bread.

Title: Beef and Potato Stir-Fry
Description: A savory stir-fry featuring tender beef slices and golden potatoes in a flavorful sauce.
Ingredients: 300g Potato (peeled and sliced into thin strips)

Steps.Content: Marinate beef with soy sauce, oyster sauce, black pepper, and cornstarch for 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, add shallots and garlic, and saut√© until fragrant.
Add potatoes and stir-fry for 5 minutes until lightly golden.
Push potatoes to the side, add beef and stir-fry on high heat until browned.
Mix everything together, add water, and let it simmer for 5 minutes until potatoes are soft.
Sprinkle with chopped green onions before serving. Enjoy with steamed rice.

Title: Garlic Butter Roasted Potatoes
Description: Crispy roasted potatoes tossed in garlic butter and herbs for a delicious side dish.

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 200¬∞C (400¬∞F).
In a bowl, mix potatoes with olive oil, salt, pepper, and paprika.
Spread potatoes on a baking sheet in a single layer and roast for 30 minutes, flipping halfway through.
In a pan, melt butter over low heat and saut√© garlic until fragrant.
Remove roasted potatoes from the oven, toss them in garlic butter, and garnish with fresh parsley.
Serve hot and enjoy!

Title: Kiwi Yogurt Smoothie
Description: A refreshing and creamy smoothie made with fresh kiwi, yogurt, and honey.

Steps.Content: Peel and slice the kiwi.
In a blender, combine kiwi, yogurt, milk, honey, and ice cubes.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

Title: Vietnamese Bamboo Shoot Soup
Description: A light and flavorful soup made with fresh bamboo shoots, pork ribs, and aromatic herbs.

Steps.Content: Boil the bamboo shoots for 5 minutes, then drain and rinse with cold water.
In a pot, heat some oil and saut√© shallots until fragrant.
Add pork ribs and sear until lightly browned.
Pour in water and bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Add bamboo shoots, fish sauce, salt, and pepper. Simmer for another 15 minutes.
Garnish with green onions and cilantro before serving.

Title: Stir-Fried Bamboo Shoots with Beef
Description: A savory stir-fry dish with tender beef slices and crunchy bamboo shoots, infused with garlic and oyster sauce.

Steps.Content: Boil the bamboo shoots for 5 minutes, drain, and rinse with cold water.
Marinate beef with soy sauce, black pepper, and sugar for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and saut√© garlic and shallot until fragrant.
Add marinated beef and stir-fry on high heat until slightly browned.
Add bamboo shoots and oyster sauce, stir well for 5 minutes.
Sprinkle chopped green onions before serving.

Title: Spicy Bamboo Shoot and Pork Stir-Fry
Description: A flavorful stir-fry with tender pork slices and bamboo shoots in a spicy, savory sauce.

Steps.Content: Boil the bamboo shoots for 5 minutes, drain, and rinse with cold water.
Marinate pork with soy sauce, black pepper, and sugar for 10 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and saut√© garlic, shallots, and chili until fragrant.
Add marinated pork and stir-fry on high heat until slightly browned.
Add bamboo shoots, fish sauce, and chili paste, stir well for 5 minutes.
Sprinkle chopped green onions before serving.

Title: Stir-Fried Luffa with Shrimp
Description: A light and savory stir-fry featuring tender luffa and succulent shrimp, perfect with steamed rice.

Steps.Content: Heat oil in a pan and saut√© garlic and shallot until fragrant.
Add shrimp and stir-fry until they turn pink and slightly curled.
Add luffa slices and stir well for 2-3 minutes.
Season with fish sauce, sugar, and black pepper. Stir-fry for another 3 minutes until luffa is tender.
Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.

Title: Luffa Soup with Minced Pork
Description: A light and nutritious soup with soft luffa and flavorful minced pork, perfect for a comforting meal.

Steps.Content: Heat oil in a pot, saut√© shallot and garlic until fragrant.
Add ground pork and stir-fry until fully cooked.
Pour in water and bring to a boil.
Add luffa slices and season with fish sauce, salt, and black pepper.
Simmer for 5 minutes until luffa is soft, then garnish with chopped green onion.

Title: Chinese-style Braised WHite Radish
Description: I love daikon radish. But mostly, I use it as a garnish or a side dish. I never thought that radish alone can make such a tasty recipe. Salads are great, but you will fall in love with this vegan recipe once you try it. The key to making tender and savory radish is braising. Braising is a common cooking method in Asian kitchens. Similar to stewing, you cook with medium-low heat for a longer time.

Steps.Content: Peel the daikon radish and roll cut into small pieces.
Rinse the scallion with water. Then remove the root, and separate the white part from the green. Cut the white part into approximately 2-inch pieces. And dice the green part finely.
Wash the fresh ginger and slice it thinly. Set aside for later.
On a pan, heat two teaspoons of olive oil over medium-high heat. Then add ginger slices and the white stems of scallion. Saut√© and coat the pan with oil evenly.
When the scallion and ginger start to fragrant, add the daikon radish blocks to the pan. Stir-fry for 3 to 5 minutes until the surface of the radish turns slightly brown.
Add half a cup of water or just enough to cover the ingredients. Pour light soy sauce, dark soy sauce, soybean paste, and cooking wine into the pan. Stir until the water boils.
Turn the heat down to medium-low, cover the lid and simmer for 10 to 12 minutes. Check on the amount of sauce occasionally to avoid burning. Add water if needed.
Open the lid. If there‚Äôs too much liquid, turn the heat to medium-high and cook until the sauce thickens. Sprinkle the green scallion. Transfer to a plate and serve with rice or noodle.

Title: Blueberry Oat Breakfast Muffins
Description: These quick and easy blueberry oat breakfast muffins are a sweet, comforting way to start your day. Mashed banana and sweet potato puree take the place of eggs and added sugar in this vegan recipe. Picky-kid-tested and plant-based-mom-approved, these moist, low-fat, fruit-filled delights are great for any occasion!

Steps.Content: Preheat the oven to 375¬∞F. In a large bowl, combine the mashed banana, sweet potato puree, maple syrup, and vanilla.

In a small bowl, combine the oat flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and ginger. Transfer this mixture to the large bowl of wet ingredient, and mix together gently until well combined. Avoid over-mixing to prevent toughness in the final product. Fold in the blueberries.

Spoon the batter into silicone muffin cups and bake for 20 minutes or until the muffins are lightly browned. Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Store the muffins in an airtight container.

Title: Paula Deen's Okra Fritters
Description: A classic Southern snack featuring crispy okra fritters with a hint of seasoning, inspired by Paula Deen's famous recipe.

Steps.Content: Heat the vegetable oil in a cast iron Dutch oven to 350¬∞F.
In a large bowl, whisk together the self-rising flour, Paula Deen's House Seasoning, buttermilk, and egg until smooth.
Fold in the chopped okra until evenly coated.
Using a tablespoon, scoop portions of the mixture into the hot oil. Fry the fritters, flipping frequently for even browning, about 12-15 minutes total.
Remove with a slotted spoon, drain on paper towels, and serve hot.

Title: Spicy Stir-Fried Chinese Long Beans
Description: A real-world Chinese stir-fry featuring long beans, garlic, shallots, and a savory sauce with a kick of spice. Optionally enhanced with crispy bacon.
Ingredients: 2 tbsp toban djan (Chinese chili bean sauce)
2 tbsp oyster sauce (or vegetarian oyster sauce)
1 tbsp cooking oil (if using center cut bacon)
6 slices thick center cut bacon, cut into bite sizes (optional)
1 lb long beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

Steps.Content: In a small bowl, combine the toban djan, oyster sauce, and sugar to form the sauce. Set aside.
Heat a wok over high heat. Add the oil and bacon (if using) and fry until the bacon edges are crispy and fat is released.
Add the chopped garlic and shallot; stir fry for 30 seconds to 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in the prepared sauce and stir fry for another 30 seconds to 1 minute, being careful not to burn the garlic.
Add the long beans and chicken stock, then cover with a lid and let steam for 5‚Äì6 minutes until the beans are tender-crisp.
Transfer to a serving plate and serve hot.

Title: Stir-Fried Garlic String Beans (3 Ingredients Only)
Description: A super simple stir-fry featuring string beans, garlic, and salt. Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside‚Äîjust like the Chinese restaurant favorite.

Steps.Content: Trim the ends of the string beans, rinse, and pat them dry.

Heat 1/2 cup of vegetable oil in a small shallow pan or wok over medium-high heat. Fry the string beans in batches for about 30‚Äì60 seconds per side until they‚Äôre lightly blistered and crispy. Remove and drain on paper towels.
In a clean pan, add 1 tbsp of oil over medium-high heat. Saut√© the minced garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Return the fried string beans to the pan, sprinkle with salt, and toss to combine. Stir-fry for another minute so the flavors meld.
Transfer to a serving plate and enjoy hot as a side dish!

Title: Chinese Garlic String Beans
Description: A quick and healthy stir-fry featuring crisp string beans blistered with garlic and tossed in a light, savory sauce. Perfect as a side dish for any meal!
Ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil or avocado oil
1-2 tbsp coconut aminos or low-sodium soy sauce

Steps.Content: Heat a large skillet or wok on medium high heat for 3 to 5 minutes. When the pan is hot, swirl in the avocado oil and add the green beans.
Cook, stirring frequently, for 3 to 5 minutes or until the green beans are blistered and tender.
Transfer the green beans to a platter, leaving the oil in the skillet.
Turn down the heat to medium and add the minced garlic to the empty pan. Cook, stirring frequently, until the garlic is fragrant but doesn‚Äôt burn. Pour in the broth and scrape up the browned bits.
Next, add the coconut aminos, and Umami Stir-Fry Powder, Spicy Sichuan Powder, or Diamond Crystal kosher salt and stir up any browned bits. Taste and adjust the sauce for seasoning.
Add the blistered green beans back in the pan and toss well to coat the beans with the garlic sauce. Plate and serve!

Title: Strawberry Spinach Salad with Poppy Seed Dressing
Description: A refreshing salad featuring baby spinach, juicy strawberries, red onion, and a tangy poppy seed dressing.
Ingredients: 1 quart strawberries - cleaned, hulled and sliced
10 ounces fresh spinach - rinsed, dried and torn into bite-size pieces

Steps.Content: Gather all ingredients.
Make dressing: Whisk together sugar, oil, vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, onion, paprika, and Worcestershire in a medium bowl. Cover and chill for 1 hour.
Make salad: Combine strawberries, spinach, and almonds in a large bowl. Pour dressing over salad; toss to coat.
Refrigerate for 10 to 15 minutes before serving.

Title: Classic Strawberry Shortcake
Description: A timeless dessert featuring sweet macerated strawberries, fluffy whipped cream, and tender shortcakes.
Ingredients: ¬º cup white sugar, plus more for topping
¬º cup heavy whipping cream, plus more for brushing
4 pints fresh strawberries, hulled and quartered

Steps.Content: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Stir continually, letting foam dissipate, just until butter begins to brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
Whisk self-rising flour and 1/4 cup white sugar together in a bowl. Add milk, 1/4 cup cream, and toasted butter; mix just until combined.

Turn dough out onto a floured surface; press or roll into a rectangle about 1-inch thick. Cut in half lengthwise, then cut each half into three portions. Place shortcake portions on the prepared baking sheet. Brush with cream; sprinkle with sugar.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 18 minutes. Transfer shortcakes to a rack to cool completely.
Sprinkle sliced strawberries with 1/4 cup sugar; stir until sugar begins to dissolve. Refrigerate until juice from berries is extracted, about 1 hour.
Beat 3/4 cup cream, 1 tablespoon sugar, and few drops vanilla extract in a bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form.

Split shortcakes in half; place bottom half in a bowl. Spoon strawberries and juice over shortcake half; top with shortcake top. Spoon more strawberries and juice over shortbread. Finish with a dollop of whipped cream.

Title: Strawberry Banana Smoothie
Description: This classic strawberry banana smoothie recipe is easy to make with 4 simple ingredients in less than 5 minutes, and always tastes so sweet and refreshing!

Steps.Content: Combine ingredients. Add all ingredients to a blender.
Blend. Pulse until smooth. (If your smoothie seems too thick, add in a bit of extra milk or water. If it seems too thin, add in more strawberries or banana.)
Serve. Then pour the smoothie into a serving glass or two‚Ä¶and enjoy!

Title: Strawberry Basil Bruschetta
Description: Greek yogurt, fresh strawberries, basil and balsamic reduction over a French baguette gives you perfection.

Steps.Content: Pour the vinegar in a small sauce pan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Lower the heat and continue cooking, stirring occasionally for about 10 minutes or until vinegar thickens so that it‚Äôs close to a honey consistency. Let cool.
Bake the French baguette slices until toasted. I actually placed mine under the broiler for about a minute on both sides, make sure you don‚Äôt burn them.

Spread some yogurt over each slice, then top with strawberries and chopped basil. Drizzle a bit of the balsamic reduction over each slice and top with slivered almonds for a bit of crunch. Finish of with some freshly ground black pepper.

Title: Strawberry Balsamic Chicken
Description: This strawberry balsamic chicken is a delicious and easy fruity version of caprese that I adore!
Ingredients: 1 pint fresh strawberries, hulled and roughly chopped
4 oz. fresh mozzarella ball (or shredded mozzarella), roughly chopped

Steps.Content: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.

Combine chicken breasts and 1/2 cup balsamic in a ziplock bag. Refrigerate for at least 5 minutes, or up to 5 hours. When ready to cook, place chicken in a baking dish and pour the remaining vinegar on top. Season chicken generously with salt and pepper. Bake for 30 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink inside.

Meanwhile, bring the remaining 1/2 cup vinegar to a boil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until reduced by half. Remove and set aside.
In a small bowl, stir together strawberries, mozzarella and basil to make a caprese topping.
When the chicken is ready, transfer to serving dishes. Then top with the strawberry caprese topping, and then drizzle with the reduced balsamic vinegar.

Title: Hyacinth Bean Sweet Soup
Description: A traditional Vietnamese sweet soup from Hu·∫ø made with hyacinth beans, coconut milk, brown sugar, and pandan leaves. Enjoy it warm or chilled!

Steps.Content: Soak hyacinth beans in cold water (cover all beans) and bring to cook until it boils. Then, wait for 1 night.
Next day, bring to clean and spread out all covers of beans. If you see any bean floats on water, take it out because of its bad quality.
Clean well again and bring to steam until they are soft.
Cook water (3 ‚Äì 4 bowls) with brown sugar cubes (depend on your flavor) and a little salt until it boils. Next, add pandan leaves into pot (tie like a bunch before adding into pot).
Mix tapioca starch with 100ml water, pour slowly into mixture in step 4, use wood spoon to stir well and gently. When it becomes thicker is perfect.

Now, you add steamed hyacinth beans into mixture in step 5, stir gently to make sure these beans will not be broken. Season again to suit your flavor and turn off the heat, add more vanilla starch and stir gently.

Title: Vietnamese Green Papaya Salad
Description: This super fresh Vietnamese-inspired green papaya salad is packed with crunchy raw veggies, roasted peanuts, and fried shallots and tossed with a bright and citrusy lime dressing! It‚Äôs easy to prepare, refreshing, and plant-based!

Steps.Content: Peel and slice the papaya. Start by peeling the papaya skin using a vegetable peeler. Then, slice it in half lengthwise. Using an ice cream scoop or a regular spoon, scoop out the seeds and discard them.
Let it soak. Transfer the green papaya halves to a large bowl and cover with cold water. Let it soak for about 15 minutes.

Grate it into thin strips. Next, drain the papaya well and pat it dry using kitchen paper towels. Using a vegetable grater or a food processor fitted with the grating disk, grate the papaya into long and thin strips (also called julienne).

Soak the papaya strips. Transfer the papaya strips to a large bowl, cover with ice-cold water, and add 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Let it sit for 10 minutes (this step helps crisp up the papaya by extracting some of the water, as well as more latex). Drain and squeeze firmly with your hands to remove excess water. Transfer the drained papaya strips to a large mixing bowl.
Slice the other vegetables. In the meantime, julienne the carrot (grate it into long strips) and thinly slice the cucumber. Transfer to the mixing bowl.
Mince the aromatics. Finely mince the garlic and chili. Alternatively, you can crush them in a mortar and pestle.
Combine everything. Add the minced garlic, chili, fish sauce, sugar, and lime juice to a small bowl. Stir until the sugar has completely dissolved.
Toss the salad with the dressing. Finally, toss the green papaya and carrots with the dressing. Incorporate the fresh herbs, peanuts, and fried shallots, and toss again. Serve immediately!

Title: Vietnamese Papaya Soup with Pork
Description: Vietnamese folk remedy says Papaya Soup, or Canh Du Du, stimulates lactation in new mothers. Whether it‚Äôs true or not, I surely didn‚Äôt complain when I was endlessly served Canh Du Du after the birth of my children. Canh Du Du and Vietnamese Sour Catfish Soup (Canh Chua) are two my favorite Vietnamese soups.
Ingredients: 1 lb pork shoulder (cut into small cubes, blanch in boiling salted water for 5 minutes, then rinse)
1 1/2 lbs ripened yet firm papaya flesh (cut into small cubes)
1 teaspoon chicken bouillon powder (or 1 teaspoon salt if none is available)

Steps.Content: Add vegetable oil to the bottom of a small pot. Heat on high. Add shallots and garlic. Stir until shallot and garlic are limp and fragrant (about 15 seconds).
Add pork. Toss until it is evenly coated with the aromatics.
Add water. Be careful as oil may splatter. Bring the pot to a boil then reduce heat to low. Simmer for 25 minutes or until pork is chopstick or fork tender. Occasionally skim off the foam at the top.
Add papaya. Cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and chicken soup powder.
Turn off heat. Garnish with cilantro.

Title: Vietnamese Papaya Smoothie
Description: A refreshing papaya smoothie blending ripe papaya, yogurt, and a hint of condensed milk for a creamy, tropical treat.

Steps.Content: Peel and deseed the papaya. Cut into chunks.
Add papaya, ice cubes, milk and condensed milk to the blender. Blend on high speed until fully blended
Pour into a glass and enjoy!

Title: Pineapple Chicken Stir-Fry
Description: This pineapple chicken stir fry recipe has a deliciously sweet and tangy sauce that perfectly coats the tender chicken, pineapple, and veggies. It costs less than takeout! This dish is flavored with fish sauce, sugar, and a hint of black pepper ‚Äì a perfect balance of tangy and sweet.
Ingredients: 2 cups fresh pineapple, cut into chunks

Steps.Content: Prepare ingredient
Mix the sauce ingredients together in a small bowl, then set aside. Chop the veggies. Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces and coat them in the garlic powder, pepper, and cornstarch.

Pan fry the chicken in olive oil in two batches in a skillet. That way it‚Äôll brown up nicely and won‚Äôt steam by being too crowded. Transfer to a plate once cooked to 165F. In the skillet, stir fry the pineapple.
Add in the veggies, and cook until tender-crisp. Return the chicken back to the pan. Pour in the sauce, and let it bubble until thickened. Garnish with scallions if desired.

Title: Vietnamese Sweet & Sour Soup
Description: This is a simplified but still flavorful version of my mom's Vietnamese Sweet and Sour soup and can be ready in under 30 minutes. Pineapple is used to sweeten the broth and lemons are used for the sour element. Easy and fast to prepare.
Ingredients: juice from 16 oz can pineapple and 3 pineapple rings cut into chunks
5 Tablespoons Vietnamese or Thai fish sauce

Steps.Content: Bring water or chicken stock* to a boil.
Add tomato, pineapple juice and pineapple chunks and reduce heat to simmer for 5 minutes.
Add shrimp, optional chili, lemon, sugar, and fish sauce and simmer 3-5 minutes or until shrimp is cooked.
Add okra, bean sprouts and recao. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes.
Salt to taste and garnish with scallions and cilantro.

Title: Shrimps, bean sprouts and watermelon salad
Description: A light salad bursting with fruity flavors and the surprising tang and umami of Vietnamese fish sauce.

Steps.Content: Cook the shrimps in a frying pan, boil enough water to reach a depth of one inch. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Spread the shrimps in the boiling water and cook for two to two and a half minutes per side.
Scoop out the shrimps and dry on a bed of paper towels. Cool.
Toss the fruits and vegetables in a large mixing bowl, toss together the watermelon cubes, mandarin orange segments, bean sprouts, lettuce and feta.
Add the shrimps. Toss to distribute.Drizzle in the mixed fish sauce and toss a few more times. Serve immediately.

Title: Vietnamese Watermelon Smoothie
Description: A refreshing and creamy smoothie made with ripe watermelon, coconut water, and a squeeze of lime for a tropical Vietnamese twist.

Steps.Content: Place the watermelon cubes, coconut water, lime juice, and mint leaves in a blender.
Blend until smooth. Add ice cubes to reach your desired consistency.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

Title: Chilled Cantaloupe Soup
Description: Very refreshing fruit soup, served chilled. Great for luncheons. Garnish with mint if desired.

Steps.Content: Peel, seed, and cube the cantaloupe.

Place cantaloupe and 1/2 cup orange juice in a blender or food processor; cover, and process until smooth. Transfer to large bowl. Stir in lime juice, cinnamon, and remaining orange juice. Cover, and refrigerate for at least one hour. Garnish with mint if desired.

Title: Crisp Fried Pig's Tail
Description: A Little Porky Universe: The Qualities of a Pig's Tail
Ingredients: 2 pounds pigs tails, cut into approximately 4-inch sections
1/2 cup flour, or enough to coat the tails
1/2 cup rice wine or white wine of your choice for braising

Steps.Content: In a wok or pot, heat the quarts of oil to 350¬∞F. Carefully rinse and pat dry all the pigs' tails. Gently slip them into the oil and fry for 3 to 4 minutes, until the tails are golden brown.
Place the tails into a braising pot and cover with water. Add the garlic, onion, soy sauce, wine, and salt. Simmer for an hour, and let cool. Reserve the stock for another use.

Reheat the oil until it is 350¬∞F. Pat the tails dry with a paper towel or clean cloth, taking care that no residual stock is sticking to the surface. Roll each tail segment around in the flour, until it is evenly coated.

With one hand, very quickly slip the tail segments into the pot, using your other hand to maneuver the lid of the pot as you go along. Fry for another 3 minutes, until the tails are golden brown and crisped.

Tossing evenly, dress the tails in a mixture of soy sauce and vinegar with salt and pepper to taste. The tails will have absorbed only a bit of the dressing, but it is enough. Have a bit of the dressing handy on the side, for dipping.

Title: Vietnamese Baked Banana Cake
Description: Soft, creamy, and rich Vietnamese baked banana cake is an amazing way to use up some bananas and this is not your typical banana cake. You will love the creamy pudding-like texture.

Steps.Content: Preheat the oven to 300 F (180 C) for conventional oven, 280 F(140 C) for convection oven. Line the baking pan with parchment paper at the bottom

It is important to choose ripe bananas but not overripe ones because we need the bananas to hold their shapes. Combine salt and water in a large mixing bowl. Peel the bananas and leave them whole. Let them soak in the salt water for at least 15 minutes and up to 30 minutes. Soaking the bananas helps to prevent the bananas from turning brown and it also gives the bananas nice reddish color after being baked
After soaking the banana, cut them into about 3/4 inch thick. Do not cut too thin.
Pour rum and salt into a large skillet. Arrange the banana slices on top and cook over medium-low heat for about 5-7 minutes. Reserve about 15-20 slices to decorate the cake later
Cut the bread slices into 1/2-inch cubes or thin slices. Combine all ingredients for the coconut milk mixture.
Add the bread and the cooked bananas and stir to combine everything.
Pour into the prepared baking pan. Arrange the banana slices you reserve earlier on top
Cover the pan with a foil and put the pan on the middle rack and bake for 90 minutes.
Remove from the cake from the oven and remove the foil. Increase oven temperature to 350 F (180 C). Brush the surface of the cake with honey and melted butter mixture.
Put it back into the oven and bake for another 15 minutes or until you get a nice golden brown on top

Place the pan on a cooling rack and let the cake cool in the pan completely before unmolding and serving. Loosen the edge of the cake, put a plate on top and then carefully invert the cake upside down, peel off the parchment paper and invert it back on to a serving plate. Cut into serving size. The cake can be served at room temperature or after being chilled in the fridge. It will have a firmer texture when it‚Äôs cold

Title: Vietnamese Banana Smoothie
Description: A refreshing Vietnamese banana smoothie made with ripe bananas, ice, condensed milk (or coconut milk for a vegan version), and a squeeze of lime for extra brightness.

Steps.Content: Place bananas in the blender
Add COLD milk, the more you add, the less thick it get.
Add a spoon of Ice cream. Vanilla is standard, chocolate would be good, too.
Add condensed milk, as sweet as you like and add sugar
Blend all of them up until you see no more banana pieces inside. Around 20 secs.
Take a cup, a straw and it ready to serve. Awesome!!!

Title: White Radish Soup
Description: This clear peppery White Radish Soup with beef broth is soothing accompaniment to any rice meal. Also delicious served with thick rice noodles.

Steps.Content: Fill a large pot half full of water. Bring to a boil. Add beef neck bones or ribs. Allow it to blanch for 4 to 5 minutes. Remove with thongs and rinse in cold water.
Discard water in pot and fill with 10 cups (2.4 liters) of fresh water. Bring to a boil.
Add blanched beef neck bones or ribs, white radish, and crushed peppercorns.
Bring water back up to a boil. Reduce heat to low and allow soup to simmer for 1¬Ω hours. Skim off any scum appearing on the surface.
Season with salt and turn off heat. Serve warm in individual bowls.

Title: Vietnamese Fried Radish Rice Cakes
Description: A popular Vietnamese street food and dim sum restaurant item, these little savory rice cakes are pan-fried to crispy perfection and served with a sweet and savory soy dipping sauce.

Steps.Content: Prepare the dried ingredients: Soak the dried shrimp in hot water for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse. Chop the dried shrimp and Chinese sausage into small pieces. Add oil (1 tablespoon) to the skillet and heat on medium-high. Add dried shrimp and saut√© for about 30 seconds. Add Chinese sausage and saut√© for one minute or until you get nice caramelization on the edges of the shrimp and sausage. Transfer the mixture into another bowl and set aside.
Make the batter: Mix together the batter ingredient in a medium bowl until you get a paste-like consistency. Set aside.
Pan fry: Combine the batter, daikon, and dried shrimp/Chinese sausage mixture back into the skillet. Pan fry for about 5 minutes to cook off the raw flour taste.
Steam: Transfer mixture to an oiled pan. I‚Äôm using a 10‚Ä≥x5‚Ä≥ loaf pan. Place the pan into a steamer with plenty of water and steam over a medium simmer for 45 minutes.

Slice: Carefully remove the pan from the steamer and let your rice cake set for about 30 minutes. Once cooled, loosen the sides with a knife and turn it upside down onto a cutting board and slice ¬Ω-inch thick square or rectangular pieces.

Serve: To enjoy, pan-fry the radish cakes by adding a couple tablespoons oil to skillet over medium heat. Fry the cakes on both sides until golden and crispy. If serving with eggs, heat a bit of oil on the other side of the skillet and crack your desired amount of eggs into the oil. Pan fry eggs however you choose. I simply like it over-easy with no additional seasonings. Transfer the eggs and fried rice cakes to a plate. Garnish green onions (optional) and serve with your choice of soy or fish sauce dipping sauce, and a side of pickled daikon and carrot (optional).
